intro: Psychotria diversinodula, commonly known as the variable node psychotria, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue or black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria diversinodula is also noted for its role in the ecological interactions of its native habitats.
